Benchmarking clustifyR

2019-06-25

Source: vignettes/benchmark.Rmd
benchmark.Rmd

Benchmark 1. MCA lung dataset annotation using ref_tabula_muris_drop reference

library(here)
library(clustifyR)
library(tidyverse)

l_mat <- readRDS(here("MCA_lung_mat"))
l_meta <- readRDS(here("MCA_lung_meta"))
load(here("data","ref_tabula_muris_drop.rda"))
tml_ref <- ref_tabula_muris_drop[,colnames(ref_tabula_muris_drop)[str_detect(colnames(ref_tabula_muris_drop),"-Lung")][-c(8,13)]] # find lung references, remove generic terms

# default with all genes
start <- proc.time()
res <- clustify(l_mat, 
                tml_ref, 
                l_meta, 
                cluster_col = "Annotation")

res_allgenes <- cor_to_call(res, 
                            l_meta, 
                            cluster_col = "Annotation")
end <- proc.time()
names(res_allgenes) <- c("MCA annotation", "clustifyR call", "r")

print(end - start)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   1.113   0.337   1.450

print(res_allgenes, n = nrow(res_allgenes))
#> # A tibble: 32 x 3
#> # Groups:   Annotation [32]
#>    `MCA annotation`               `clustifyR call`                        r
#>    <chr>                          <chr>                               <dbl>
#>  1 Alveolar macrophage_Ear2 high… alveolar macrophage-Lung            0.879
#>  2 Alveolar macrophage_Pclaf hig… alveolar macrophage-Lung            0.714
#>  3 B Cell(Lung)                   B cell-Lung                         0.836

benchmark 2. Using sorted microarray data to classify 10x PBMC example data, available in clustifyrdata package

full_pbmc4k_matrix <- clustifyrdata::pbmc4k_matrix
full_pbmc4k_meta <- clustifyrdata::pbmc4k_meta
microarray_ref <- clustifyrdata::hema_microarray_matrix

start <- proc.time()
res <- clustify(full_pbmc4k_matrix, 
                microarray_ref, 
                full_pbmc4k_meta, 
                query_genes = pbmc4k_vargenes,
                cluster_col = "classified")

res2 <- cor_to_call(res)
end <- proc.time()
names(res2) <- c("manual annotation", "clustifyR call", "r")

print(end - start)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.077   0.007   0.083

print(res2, n = nrow(res2))
#> # A tibble: 10 x 3
#> # Groups:   cluster [10]
#>    `manual annotation` `clustifyR call`                    r
#>    <chr>               <chr>                           <dbl>
#>  1 CD4 T cells, 2      CD4+ Effector Memory            0.588
#>  2 CD8 T cells         CD8+ Effector Memory            0.584
#>  3 FCGR3A+ Monocytes   Mature NK cell_CD56- CD16+ CD3- 0.578
#>  4 NK cells            Mature NK cell_CD56+ CD16+ CD3- 0.585
#>  5 Megakaryocytes      Megakaryocyte                   0.418
#>  6 CD14+ Monocytes     Monocyte                        0.644
#>  7 Dendritic cells, 1  Myeloid Dendritic Cell          0.562
#>  8 B cells             Naïve B-cells                   0.600
#>  9 CD4 T cells, 1      Naive CD8+ T-cell               0.583
#> 10 Dendritic Cells, 2? Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cell     0.460

Comparison with other methods

using Tablua Muris (drop and facs samples) 12 shared tissues, which can be downloaded as seurat objects

  1. Building reference and then mapping:

default clustify, with all genes

clustify, pulling var.genes from seurat objects

clustify, using M3Drop for feature selection

clustify, using per_cell = T option, and then assign cluster consensus ident with collapse_to_cluster = T

clustify, after ALRA imputation, using per_cell = T option, and then assign cluster consensus ident with collapse_to_cluster = T

scmap-cluster

  1. Mapping from prebuilt all-encompassing references to the drop samples:

clustify, using ref_tabula_muris_facs

singleR, using default built-in mouse references without fine tuning

  1. Generate marker gene list (of 30 genes per reference identity), and then mapping

default clustify_list
